III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth disclosed getting hurt at the facility. It is unknown who hurts
the youth or how the youth is being hurt. Youth had no marks or
bruises.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
06/21/2023.
I contacted Complainant on 06/22/2023 and left a voicemail.
I met with Chief Administrator on 06/23/2023. She said Youth A
had been at camp this past week and returned to campus last
night. She said Youth A is easily triggered and requires a lot of
redirection, but she is not aware of any incidents involving Youth A
getting hurt or having any injuries.
I interviewed Youth A on 06/23/2023 at the facility. Youth A is 12
years old is placed at Harrison Cottage. Youth A identified Staff 1
as the staff that hit him on his shoulder. Youth A could not recall
when or where this happened. He said Staff 1 hit him on his
shoulder with his hand and told him to wake up, because he was
not paying attention. Youth A said he was not injured and does not
have a bruise. Youth A does not like some of the boys in the
cottage, because they bully him. He identified Youth B and C as
the boys that bully him. He was asked if staff are present when the
Youth B and C bully him and he replied staff are present and they
tell Youth B and C to stop. Youth A said he wants to live with his
aunt, and he is upset that his aunt and Foster Care Worker (FCW)
have not been visiting him.
I interviewed FCW on 06/23/2023 via telephone. Foster Care
Worker reported Youth A told her he does not like being at the
facility and wants to live with his aunt. She said the plan was for
Youth A to be placed with his aunt, but his aunt has changed her
mind and will not be pursuing adoption. She met with Youth A
2

today and he reported that Staff 1 hits and punches him, but he
does not have any bruises or injuries. She said there have been
no incident reports for Youth A this past month.
I interviewed Director on 06/27/2023 at the facility. Director
reported Youth A has a problem when staff redirect him or when
he does not get what he wants. He said this past weekend they
had a drawing event at campus, and Youth A alleged that
someone told him his drawing was ugly and tore it up. Director
was standing next to Youth A and did not hear anyone say
anything about Youth A’s drawing. Director said Youth A has not
reported or expressed any concerns regarding Staff 1 or any other
staff. Director is not aware of any incidents regarding Youth A
being bullied but said Youth A does sometimes argue with the
other youths in the cottage and staff will redirect when that occurs.
I interviewed Youth B on 06/27/2023 at the facility. Youth B has
been at the facility for two years and is placed in Harrison Cottage.
He denied witnessing Staff 1, or any other staff hit or punch Youth
A. He said when he or any other youth break the rules or get in
trouble, they cannot play video games. He denied bullying Youth
A. Youth B reported he likes all the staff and feels safe.
I interviewed Youth C on 06/27/2023 at the facility. Youth C has
been at the facility for over one year and is placed in Harrison
Cottage. Youth C reported he does not interact with the other boys
in the cottage and denied bullying Youth A. Youth C denied
witnessing Staff 1 hit or punch Youth A. Youth C reported feeling
safe and did not express any concerns regard staff or the facility.
I interviewed Supervisor on 06/27/2023 at the facility. Supervisor
reported he is very familiar with Youth A. Youth has not reported
any concerns regarding Staff 1 and he has not witnessed Staff 1
hit or punch Youth A. He said Youth A is easily triggered and is
usually the one that yells and uses profanity with Staff and other
youths.
I interviewed Staff 1 on 06/30/2023 via telephone on 06/30/2023.
Staff 1 has been working at the facility for 4 months, has
completed all his training including CPI. Staff 1 denied hitting or
punching Youth A. Staff 1 said Youth A gets upset and angry
when he does not get what he wants and is the one that usually
yells or kicks staff. Staff 1 said he usually will block or move away
way from Youth A when Youth A is escalated. Staff 1 said he uses
verbal de-escalation and has never restrained or attempted to
restrain Youth A.
3

I interviewed Staff 2 on 06/30/2023 via telephone on 06/30/2023.
Staff 2 has been working at the facility for 5 years. He completed
the refresher CPI training in April. He reported Youth A requires
constant redirection due to his behavior but denied staff hitting or
punching Youth A. He said Youth A is the one that is usually
physical aggressive with staff and other youths. Staff will redirect
and use verbal de-escalation with Youth A.
I interviewed Staff 3 on 07/03/2023 at the facility. Staff 3 is the
Family Transition Coordinator assigned to Youth A. Staff 3 said
Youth A has never reported being hit or punched by staff.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 04/22/2023 written by Staff 1. Youth A
used the curtain rod to break his bedroom window.
• Personnel file for Staff 1 - no disciplinary action.
Analysis There is insufficient evidence of Youth A being hurt by staff. Based
on interviews with Staff, Supervisor, and youths there is no evidence
Youth A is being hit or punched.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
